item.description:
"At 20 years of age the will reigns, at 30 the wit, at 40 the judgement, and at 303 our feet." Let's explore the life of Benjamin Franklin and walk among the sites of his homes and haunts in Boston!

A signer of both the Declaration of Independence and the United States Constitution, Franklin's colorful life and contributions as an author, entrepreneur, inventor, scientist, statesman and diplomat earned him the status as one of the most influential and recognizable of the Founding Fathers on both sides of the Atlantic.

What is less well known is that this remarkable life began as the 15th child of a tallow chandler in the Puritan town of Boston. Before his kite-flying days, young Franklin lived a humble Puritan life as a voracious reader, resourceful inventor, a printer's apprentice and with a sense of humor.

Join us on a trip back to Colonial Boston to celebrate the life of Benjamin Franklin!

Tickets for this tour are $15 ($5 for Boston By Foot members). The tour meets outside Border Books near Downtown Crossing.

"Never leave that till tomorrow which you can RSVP today."
item.how_to_find_us: Our guides will be standing outside the main entrance to Borders, at the corner of School and Washington Streets. They'll be wearing blue and white buttons that say "Boston By Foot"!
item.name: Ben Franklin: A Birthday Tour
